segment.source: Package a job and run it on another computer
segment.target: Package a job and run it on another computer

segment.source: Package a job and run it on another computer
segment.target: Package a job and run it on another computer

segment.source: Package a job and run it on another computer
segment.target: Package a job and run it on another computer

segment.source: When you create a job that you want to run on a different computer, you don't have to install the Windows Assessment Toolkit on that computer.
segment.target: When you create a job that you want to run on a different computer, you don't have to install the Windows Assessment Toolkit on that computer.

segment.source: You can use the Windows Assessment Console to package that job so that it includes all the necessary files and tools to run on a different computer.
segment.target: You can use the Windows Assessment Console to package that job so that it includes all the necessary files and tools to run on a different computer.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: A packaged job can run from a network share, but for best results run the job from the local computer to reduce run-time failures, or performance issues caused by the network.
segment.target: A packaged job can run from a network share, but for best results run the job from the local computer to reduce run-time failures, or performance issues caused by the network.

segment.source: To package a job to run on a different computer
segment.target: To package a job to run on a different computer

segment.source: To find and start the Windows Assessment Console, click Start, type assessment console, and then click Windows Assessment Console.
segment.target: To find and start the Windows Assessment Console, click Start, type assessment console, and then click Windows Assessment Console.

segment.source: In the Windows Assessment Console, select a job from the Home page, select a single assessment, create a new job, or open an existing job.
segment.target: In the Windows Assessment Console, select a job from the Home page, select a single assessment, create a new job, or open an existing job.

segment.source: After you open the job, adjust the job settings and the assessment parameters as needed.
segment.target: After you open the job, adjust the job settings and the assessment parameters as needed.

segment.source: Click Package.
segment.target: Click Package.

segment.source: In the Package a Job to Run on Another Computer dialog box, type notes that will help you identify your job when you select results to open and view.
segment.target: In the Package a Job to Run on Another Computer dialog box, type notes that will help you identify your job when you select results to open and view.

segment.source: In the Package path box, type the location where you want to store the job package.
segment.target: In the Package path box, type the location where you want to store the job package.

segment.source: This location can be on the local computer, or removable media such as a USB flash drive.
segment.target: This location can be on the local computer, or removable media such as a USB flash drive.

segment.source: In the Results path box, type the location where you want to store the results.
segment.target: In the Results path box, type the location where you want to store the results.

segment.source: By default, this is the relative path of a Results folder in the same location where the job runs.
segment.target: By default, this is the relative path of a Results folder in the same location where the job runs.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: When the job is packaged, the location where you stored the job will open.
segment.target: When the job is packaged, the location where you stored the job will open.

segment.source: You can take the folder to another computer and run the job without installing the Windows Assessment Toolkit by using the RunJob.cmd file that's in the folder.
segment.target: You can take the folder to another computer and run the job without installing the Windows Assessment Toolkit by using the RunJob.cmd file that's in the folder.

segment.source: To run a packaged job on a different computer
segment.target: To run a packaged job on a different computer

segment.source: Take the folder that contains the packaged job to the computer where you want to run the job.
segment.target: Take the folder that contains the packaged job to the computer where you want to run the job.

segment.source: Open the folder and double-click the RunJob.cmd file.
segment.target: Open the folder and double-click the RunJob.cmd file.

segment.source: In User Account Control, click Yes.
segment.target: In User Account Control, click Yes.

segment.source: In the Assessment Launcher window, add run notes.
segment.target: In the Assessment Launcher window, add run notes.

segment.source: In the Results path box, type a new location if you want to change the location that was specified when the job was packaged.
segment.target: In the Results path box, type a new location if you want to change the location that was specified when the job was packaged.

segment.source: Click Run Job on this Machine.
segment.target: Click Run Job on this Machine.

segment.source: If the Microsoft Assessment Launcher window appears, you can cancel the job or click Details to monitor the progress of the job.
segment.target: If the Microsoft Assessment Launcher window appears, you can cancel the job or click Details to monitor the progress of the job.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For some assessments, you'll see the Assessment Launcher window briefly, but it doesn't persist for job monitoring.
segment.target: For some assessments, you'll see the Assessment Launcher window briefly, but it doesn't persist for job monitoring.

segment.source: Before the job starts, the job checks the computer configuration to make sure that the assessment can run successfully.
segment.target: Before the job starts, the job checks the computer configuration to make sure that the assessment can run successfully.

segment.source: The job generates error messages, warnings, and informational messages based on the computer configuration and the needs of the assessment.
segment.target: The job generates error messages, warnings, and informational messages based on the computer configuration and the needs of the assessment.

segment.source: When the job finishes, the results appear in the Windows Assessment Console and are saved in the Results folder that you specified.
segment.target: When the job finishes, the results appear in the Windows Assessment Console and are saved in the Results folder that you specified.

segment.source: After you run a job on a different computer, you can import the results into the results library on the computer where the Windows Assessment Console is installed and compare the results across multiple computers.
segment.target: After you run a job on a different computer, you can import the results into the results library on the computer where the Windows Assessment Console is installed and compare the results across multiple computers.

segment.target: Related topics
